Description

Destruction rituals involve violent or fierce action (darg po'i las), sometimes for religious ends, but often to bring harm to or to kill an enemy.

Related Terms

  • mngon spyod kyi las (wrathful magic) = abhicāra;
  • drag po'i las (wrathful ritual);
  • hom, hom gyi las (hom-pit rituals);
  • khrag sbyor (blood practice);
  • las mtha' (extreme rituals)

Example Texts

  • mngon spyod kyi las (Toh. 484)
  • drag sngags mngon spyod kyi rnam bzhag 
  • rdo rje legs pa'i las mtha' gnam lcags thog chen 
  • rten 'brel snying po'i drag po'i las byang 
  • drag po'i las bskul ba 
  • tsi'u dmar po'i phrin las 

Secondary Sources

Nebesky-Wojkowitz, René de. "Destructive Magic." In Oracles and Demons of Tibet: The Cult and Iconography of the Tibetan Protective Deities, 481-502. Netherlands: Mouton & Co., 1956.

Norbu, Namkhai. "The Bön of Magic Power: The Rites of Destruction." In Drung, Deu and Bön: Narrations, Symbolic Languages and the Bön Tradition in Ancient Tibet, 199-218. Dharamsala: Library of Tibetan Works and Archives, 1995.
